page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: trees as possible when designing his master plan. There is a great variety of trees in the town area, but not very many are elms because of Dutch Elm disease which killed off most of the elms a few years ago. The River Stort flows through the area from east to west. The land north of the river up to the A 414 south of Eastwick is low-lying and often gets flooded in the winter and spring. It is of no use for arable farming and usually has sheep grazing on it. Most of the soil in the area is boulder clay which makes it suitable for wheat growing.
